items.title: AI scare’s $56 billion hit tests resilience of TCS, Infosys and other Indian IT stocks

Despite short-term volatility, analysts say strong fundamentals and long-term growth prospects could help these companies navigate the turbulence and recover over time.

items.summary: India’s unemployment rate rose in January, as both PLFS and CMIE data shows. But in an economy marked by informal work and weak productivity, the joblessness count matters less than the quality of jobs. On this score, ‘developed economy’ status seems very far away.

items.title: Gold, silver import surge pushes India’s January trade deficit to 3-month high of $34.68 billion
items.summary: Surging gold and silver imports widened India’s January trade deficit to $34.68 billion. Imports jumped 19% while exports barely grew, with services offering limited relief amid weak global demand.

items.title: Banks ramp up bad loan sales to ARCs in December quarter, retail NPAs at Rs 24,814 crore
items.summary: Industry data up to December 2025 showed that banks sold Rs 24,814 crore retail non-performing assets (NPAs) to asset reconstruction companies (ARC). That compares with Rs 9,093 crore of retail bad loans sold up to September.

items.title: Who is Tom Pritzker? Hyatt Hotels heir steps down citing Epstein connection
items.summary: Who is Tom Pritzker? The heir to the Hyatt Hotels fortune has stepped down as executive chairman, citing regret over his association with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, as newly released files reveal years of post-2008 contact.

items.title: IIFL Finance won't go all-out on gold loans next fiscal
items.summary: Gold loans form the largest share of IIFL Finance’s standalone loan book, which has helped the non-bank lender expand it sharply from about  ₹27,508 crore in March 2025 to over  ₹49,000 crore as of December.

items.summary: Travellers can load the wallet using various payment methods and make transactions by scanning UPI QR codes via the PPI-UPI application

items.title: It's raining rewards points as e-retailers chase loyalty
items.summary: The rise in reward-point redemption frequency, even as per-transaction ticket sizes have moderated, suggests points are increasingly being used for regular expenses rather than saved for indulgences.

items.title: High demand for domestic AI infra, Neysa AI CEO says
items.summary: The firm has just raised $600 million from Blackrock, and seeks to raise more, for procuring and running GPUs in India for enterprise clients looking for locally deployed AI.

items.title: Landmark Greenwashing Case Against Gas Producer Santos Dismissed
items.summary: A judge dismissed a long-running legal challenge against Santos Ltd., which had accused the Australian oil and gas producer of misleading investors over its climate strategy.

items.title: BHP Profit Climbs as Copper Offsets China Drag on Iron Ore
items.summary: BHP Group’s earnings for the six months to the end of December rose by more than a fifth thanks to a surge in copper prices, even as plateauing demand in China weighed on its iron ore and steelmaking coal businesses.

items.summary: The UR (unemployment rate) or joblessness recorded a marginal increase in January in both rural and urban areas, showed the latest Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS)

Tit for TAT: Lenders seek reset of compensation rules on ATM fraud
items.summary: Banks are flagging a new ATM fraud to the Reserve Bank of India.  This power-off fraud tricks systems into dispensing cash during withdrawals.  Banks want clearer rules to avoid paying for these fraudulent transactions.  Existing compensation guidelines are being exploited.  This issue is causing significant disputes and financial losses for banks across India.

items.title: Oil prices rise 1% ahead of US-Iran nuclear talks
items.summary: GLOBAL-OIL:Oil prices rise 1% ahead of US-Iran nuclear talks

items.title: Govt extends bid deadline for small oil blocks
items.summary: The government has extended the bid submission deadline for the discovered small fields round. This is the fourth such auction. The new deadline is March 18. This process offers 55 discoveries across nine contract areas. Small discoveries previously deemed unviable are now available under attractive terms. This aims to boost exploration and production.

items.title: ET Graphics: Active buyers go for premium homes
items.summary: The shift suggests the current housing cycle is being driven less by entry-level buyers and more by upgrade purchases. Sales in the Rs 50 lakh-Rs 1 crore category also dropped 8%, suggesting affordability constraints are affecting both lower and mid-income purchasers rather than the housing market as a whole.

items.title: ET Now GBS 2026: AI can cut healthcare costs and bridge talent gap, say industry leaders
items.summary: Industry leaders emphasized the need for academia and industry collaboration to equip India's youth for AI-centric jobs. AI is poised to significantly reduce healthcare costs and bridge the talent gap, enabling remote medical expertise and improving diagnostic efficiency.  This technological revolution presents a substantial opportunity for India's demographic dividend.

items.title: 'Gap between capital value growth and rental gains widens in housing market'
items.summary: India's rental housing market is adjusting. Property prices rose, but rental demand dipped. Rental yields are stable across major cities. Tenant preference leans towards mid-sized, semi-furnished homes. Competition is high for affordable rentals. The market is becoming more balanced and discerning.

items.title: Serials lose the plot as they make it to the big screen
items.summary: This September, Excel Entertainment plans to issue the film adaptation of its web series 'Mirzapur, titled Mirzapur: The Movie'. A challenging aspect of film adaptations of successful IPs of TV and streaming platforms is they appear like extended versions of original medium of storytelling, producers say.

items.title: Indian pharma may take AI pill to cut time and costs in drug R&D
items.summary: Indian pharmaceutical giants Sun Pharma and Glenmark are embracing Artificial Intelligence to speed up new drug creation. This technology promises to cut development times and costs. Global investment in AI for drug discovery is rapidly increasing. Companies are looking to AI for expertise and efficiency. This innovation is set to transform drug research and development cycles.

items.title: Jindal Power, Vedanta and Havells among 22 bidders for Gupta Power
items.summary: Jindal Power, Vedanta, and Havells India are among 22 potential bidders for debt-laden Gupta Power Infrastructure, which faces insolvency proceedings with admitted claims of ₹4,240 crore. Other interested parties include UltraTech Cement and Torrent Electricals. The company manufactures cables, wire rods, and conductors.

items.title: Rising middle class, talent make India a good place to invest in: Bernard Mensah, President of International, Bank of America
items.summary: Bank of America's Bernard Mensah sees India as a prime investment destination, citing its growing middle class, strong institutions, and reformist government. The bank is increasing its India limits, anticipating more M&A activity fueled by regulatory liberalization and a focus on supply chain resilience. Despite geopolitical risks, Mensah believes capitalism's core architecture remains intact.

items.title: In God they trust: Realtors make a beeline for temple towns
items.summary: Developers are investing in temple towns like Ayodhya and Vrindavan. Govt initiatives are boosting religious tourism. This growth is expected to create demand for hotels, retail spaces, and residential properties. Experts anticipate significant development in these spiritual hubs over the coming years. New hotel rooms are projected, and a ripple effect is expected across various real estate sectors.

items.title: Retail set to soar, but firms have a fight on their hands
items.summary: India's retail market is set for massive growth by 2035.  However, retailers must adapt.  Consumers are more selective, demanding convenience and personalization.  Store expansion and discounts are no longer enough.  Technology, especially AI, will be crucial for future success.  Retailers need clear strategies to focus on specific customer segments and leverage AI for growth.

items.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman to push biopharma, semiconductor missions in Norway
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is in Oslo to boost India's bio-pharma and semiconductor sectors. She will meet Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store and discuss capital investments with industry leaders. Sitharaman will also highlight India's Biopharma SHAKTI plan and semiconductor missions. Earlier, she attended the Munich Security Conference, emphasizing economic stability's link to global security.

items.title: Trent is now focusing more on smaller towns: CEO
items.summary: Trent is focusing its expansion on smaller towns. The company is opening many new stores in tier 3 and tier 4 cities. This strategy aims to tap into the growing fashion adoption by young customers in these areas. Trent believes these smaller markets will become very attractive in the coming years. The company is confident in this new growth direction.

items.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 5% in January, higher rise for females
items.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in January, reaching 5%. Joblessness rose more significantly for women compared to men. Rural unemployment edged up, while urban unemployment also increased. The labour force participation rate experienced a minor dip. Youth unemployment also saw a rise, primarily driven by female joblessness.

items.title: NGT green signal for Nicobar Port; notes safeguards
items.summary: In a significant decision, the National Green Tribunal has green-lighted the ambitious Great Nicobar mega infrastructure project. After thorough inspection, the tribunal determined that the environmental clearances come with robust protective measures. It underlined the project's vital role in regional development.

items.title: Telcos want net neutrality rules updated for 5G era
items.summary: Telecom operators such as Reliance Jio have submitted comments concerning net neutrality to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (Trai), asking the regulator to update the norms that will support slicing for tariff products such as a defined upload speed slice and low latency gaming slice.

items.title: Tata Sons brings in former civil aviation secretary as Air India faces regulatory hurdles
items.summary: Tata Sons has appointed former civil aviation secretary Pradeep Singh Kharola as an advisor for its aviation business. This move aims to bolster Air India's turnaround efforts. Kharola's expertise will be crucial in managing government communications. Air India faces significant regulatory scrutiny and operational challenges. The airline is also undergoing a leadership transition.

items.title: 29 vitamin-mineral FDC drugs under review for possible ban over 'irrational' tag
items.summary: A looming ban on twenty-nine vitamin and mineral combination drugs has sparked a heated debate. Initially flagged as irrational by an expert panel in 2015, these products are now being re-evaluated by a specialized sub-committee. Before any final ruling, the companies will be given a chance to defend their products.

items.title: European Stocks Gain as Banks Rebound, Earnings Remain in Focus
items.summary: European stocks gained as bank shares rebounded, after posting their biggest weekly decline since April on worries about disruption from artificial intelligence.

items.title: Wholesale inflation touches 10-month high of 1.8% in January
items.summary: India's wholesale inflation reached a 10-month peak of 1.81 percent in January. This rise was fueled by higher costs for food, non-food articles, and manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw its first reading under a new series. Economists noted a gradual increase in inflation since October 2025. The core WPI segment showed a significant jump.

items.title: European Stocks Muted as Tech Suffers; Dassault Systemes Falls
items.summary: European stocks were subdued as fears about the disruptive impact of artificial intelligence on industrial software canceled out a rebound in bank shares. Dassault Systemes dropped 10%.

items.title: Govt plans ‘Champion CPSEs’ for Viksit Bharat by 2047, NITI Aayog roadmap soon
items.summary: India is preparing to create 'champion' public sector companies. These firms will boost economic growth and technology. The goal is to help India become a developed nation by 2047. These companies will get more freedom in decisions and talent hiring. They will use new technologies for better performance.

items.title: India-US trade deal: Trade team heading to Washington next week for legal pact
items.summary: India's chief negotiator Darpan Jain will lead a delegation to Washington next week to finalize the legal agreement for the India-US trade deal, aiming for a March signing. The visit follows the finalization of an interim trade agreement framework, with virtual talks ongoing to translate contours into a legal pact.

items.title: IIFL Finance to raise Rs 2,000 crore through bonds; offers up to 9% yield per annum
items.summary: IIFL Finance Limited has announced the launch of a public issue of secured redeemable NCDs opening on Tuesday, February 17, 2026, with an issue size of Rs 500 crore and a green-shoe option to retain oversubscription up to Rs 1,500 crore, aggregating to a total of Rs 2,000 crore.

items.title: Quote of the day by George Soros: ‘It's not whether you're right or wrong, but how much money you make…’
items.summary: George Soros emphasises that success in financial markets is not about being right or wrong, but about the profits earned when correct and losses faced when incorrect.

items.title: Air India to strengthen network on key international routes
items.summary: Air India is boosting international travel options. New cabin interiors and more flights are coming to key routes. Passengers can expect enhanced comfort on flights to Toronto, Seoul, Shanghai, Tokyo, and London. New aircraft deliveries will further improve the travel experience. This expansion aims to offer more seats and better service across its network.

items.title: Mumbai airport: Airlines' body IATA flags concern over impact of temporary suspension of cargo operations
items.summary: Global airlines body IATA is worried about Mumbai airport's plan to stop cargo flights from August 2026. The Adani group-operated airport intends to upgrade its infrastructure. IATA has sought clarification from the airport operator but has not yet received a response. This suspension is planned until May 2027.

items.title: Meerut Metro to become India's fastest, to run at 120 kmph
items.summary: Meerut Metro will soon be India's fastest metro, operating at 120 kmph. This new service connects Meerut South to Modipuram over 21 km in about 30 minutes. It will run on the same tracks as Namo Bharat trains, creating an integrated transport system. Modern trains will offer energy efficiency and advanced technology.

items.title: IndiGo extends cancellation of Tbilisi, Almaty, Baku, Tashkent flights till Mar 28
items.summary: IndiGo has extended flight cancellations to Tbilisi, Almaty, Baku, and Tashkent until March 28, 2026, citing ongoing developments around Iran and its airspace. items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
